author: uink45
content: Is there any possibility of improving support for light client data over Libp2p? It would be useful for tracking sync committee participation without relying on RPC endpoints.

author: sproul
content: Yeah, it's just a matter of implementing it. Lodestar and Nimbus are the only clients with complete impls AFAIK

author: dapplion
content: one strategy is to compute those proofs ahead of time when the state is guaranteed to be available (after block processing), and then retrieve to produce the full lc message

author: sproul
content: Yeah I think we came to the same conclusion, but had an external contrib working on it and not enough momentum. I think some of us (not me) are looking to revive the light client server in LH, so it may be coming ðŸ”œ

author: dirkjaeckel
content: That is really unfortunate. As a light client is there any way to only create connections to nodes that do implement the optional functionality? If that is not possible, can the light client query implementation and version of the node and determine whether is is supposed to support the optional methods? And then create a list of nodes not to contact again?

author: sproul
content: This is beyond my level of networking knowledge, but I think you might want the discv5 topic-based discovery mentioned here, if it's implemented: <https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/phase0/p2p-interface.md#how-are-we-going-to-discover-peers-in-a-gossipsub-topic>. You want to discover peers on the `light_client_finality_update` and `light_client_optimistic_update` topics.

author: sproul
content:
^I checked with <@498009160982724610> and topic-based discovery isn't implemented yet (it's harder than you might think).
